label: Compound ID
definition: Compounds consisted of multiple households (typically 3 to 10 in Bangladesh), usually comprised of blood relatives, who share a common courtyard. Compounds were eligible to participate if (1) they had a pregnant woman and (2) the woman planned to stay in the village for the next 12 months.

label: Cluster ID
definition: The unit of randomization. A cluster consisted of a group of 8 proximate compounds (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) within a village that were visited by a single local promoter and separated by at least a 15 min walk.

label: Randomization block
definition: Each randomization block was made up of 8 adjacent clusters (groups of 8 proximate compounds) that were pair-matched by geography. Each cluster within the randomization block was randomly allocated to one of 7 intervention arms, including 2 clusters randomly allocated to the control arm.

label: Compound assessment year
definition: Calendar year in which data on households and compounds (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) were collected.

label: Compount assessment week
definition: Calendar week in which data on households and compounds (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) were collected.

label: No assessment, midline
definition: Compound not assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age).

label: Reason for no assessment, midline
definition: Reason compound was not assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age).
codebookDescription: Reason for no measurement in year 1

label: No assessment, endline
definition: Compound not assessed 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Reason for no assessment, endline
definition: Reason compound was not assessed 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).
codebookDescription: Reason for no measurement in year 2

label: Shallow tube well for compound's primary drinking water source
definition: Whether the primary water source for the target child participant's compound was a shallow tubewell. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Compound treated drinking water today or yesterday
definition: Whether the target child participant's compound reported treating their drinking water or doing anything to make it less cloudy today or yesterday. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Reported treating water today or yesterday (q1008)

label: Visible feces in compound
definition: Whether visible human feces were observed in the house or compound. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero), 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).
codebookDescription: No human feces observed in house/compound (q4201, 4203, 4205)

label: Visible feces on compound's latrine floor
definition: Whether visible human feces were observed on the slab or floor of the compound's latrine. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero), 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).
codebookDescription: No visible feces on slab/floor of latrine

label: Visible feces in compound where pregnant mother spends most time
definition: Whether human feces were observed in the location where the target child participant's pregnant mother spent the most time. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Human feces obs in loc where child spends most time (q4203: In the area where the target child spends the most time Probe and identify where the target child spends the most time.At baseline, the target child will not be present,so the search should be defined as the area where the  pregnant mother spends the most time. Human fecesin the area where the target child spends the most time that could be considered open defecation)

label: Water and soap at compound's hand washing location
definition: Whether the primary hand washing location has both water and soap. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero), 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Water at compound's hand washing location
definition: Whether the primary hand washing location has water. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero), 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Soap at compound's hand washing location
definition: Whether the primary hand washing location has soap. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero), 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Compound's hand washing location within 6 steps of toilet or latrine
definition: Whether the target child participant's compound had a handwashing station located within 6 steps of the toilet or latrine. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Has handwashing loc w/in 6 steps of latrine

label: Compound's hand washing location within 6 steps of toilet or latrine has water
definition: Whether the target child participant's compound had a handwashing station with water located within 6 steps of the toilet or latrine. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Has handwashing loc w/in 6 steps of latrine w/ water

label: Compound's hand washing location within 6 steps of toilet or latrine has soap
definition: Whether the target child participant's compound had a handwashing station with soap located within 6 steps of the toilet or latrine. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Has handwashing loc w/in 6 steps of latrine w/ soap

label: Compound's hand washing location within 6 steps of kitchen
definition: Whether the target child participant's compound had a handwashing station located within 6 steps of the kitchen. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Has handwashing loc w/in 6 steps of kitchen

label: Compound's hand washing location within 6 steps of kitchen has water
definition: Whether the target child participant's compound had a handwashing station with water located within 6 steps of the kitchen. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Has handwashing loc w/in 6 steps of kitchen w/ water

label: Compound's hand washing location within 6 steps of kitchen has soap
definition: Whether the target child participant's compound had a handwashing station with soap located within 6 steps of the kitchen. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Has handwashing loc w/in 6 steps of kitchen w/ soap

label: Daily open defecation in compound, children under 3yrs
definition: Whether children in the target child participant's compound  under 3 years of age  practice open defecation daily. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Daily open defecation in compound, children 3-8yrs
definition: Whether children in the target child participant's compound  3-8 years of age  practice open defecation daily. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Daily open defecation in compound, children 8-15yrs
definition: Whether children in the target child participant's compound  8-15 years of age  practice open defecation daily. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Daily open defecation in compound, adult men
definition: Whether adult men in the target child participant's compound practice open defecation daily. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Daily open defecation in compound, adult women
definition: Whether adult women in the target child participant's compound practice open defecation daily. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Unshared toilet or latrine
definition: Whether the target child participant's household had its own latrine (did not share with other households in the compound). Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Compound's toilet or latrine has concrete floor
definition: Whether the target child participant's toilet or latrine had a concrete floor or slab. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Compound's toilet has functional water seal
definition: Whether the flush or pour flush toilet has a functional water seal. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero), 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Compound potty
definition: Whether the target child participant's compound had a potty for child defecation. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Has a potty for child defecation

label: Compound stored drinking water
definition: Whether drinking water for the compound was stored. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero), 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Chlorine detected in compound's stored drinking water
definition: Whether more than 0.1 mg/L of free residual chlorine was detected in stored drinking water. Only water samples collected from compounds that reported treating their drinking water with some form of chlorine were tested. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).
codebookDescription: Free chlorine detected in stored water (>0.1 mg/L)

label: Compound time to drinking water source (min)
definition: Distance (measured in minutes to walk one way) to the primary water source from the target child participant's home. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Persons living in compound
definition: Total number of people that lived in the target child participant's compound. Assessed for the compound (multiple households sharing a common courtyard) at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Improved roof material
definition: Whether the observed main roof material of the target child participant's dwelling was tin or cement. Tin or cement roofs were classified as "improved". Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Improved wall material
definition: Whether the observed main wall material of the target child participant's dwelling was wood, brick, or tin. Wood, brick, or tin walls were classified as "improved". Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Improved floor material
definition: Whether the observed main floor material of the target child participant's dwelling was wood or concrete. Wood or concrete floors were classified as "improved". Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Cement floor
definition: Whether the target child participant's dwelling has a cement floor. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Household Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS)
definition: Household Food Insecurity Access Scale category, based on method described in Coates et al. Household Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS) for Measurement of Household Food Access: Indicator Guide (v. 3). Washington, DC: Food and Nutrition Technical Assistance Project, Academy for Educational Development, 2007.  Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Household Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS) score
definition: Sum of 9 variables assessing household food access in the past four weeks. Values can range from 0 (least food access insecure) to 27 (most food access insecure). Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Union council
definition: The smallest rural administrative or local government unit in Bangladesh.

label: Intervention assignment
definition: The actual randomized, blinded intervention assigned to the cluster.

label: Study timepoint for compound assessment
definition: Survey data on compounds and households was collected at enrollment (baseline), and outcomes were measured after 12 months (midline) and 24 months (endline) of intervention delivery.

label: Percent LNS consumed
definition: Percent of expected lipid-based nutrient supplement (LNS) sachets consumed by the household per week. Based on counting sachets present at the time of a field visit. The expected number of sachets for 100% adherence is 14 sachets (7 days x 2 sachets per day). Values of LNS consumed that were negative or >28 were flagged. Assessed for the household 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: LNS consumed
definition: Number of lipid-based nutrient supplement (LNS) sachets consumed by the household per week. Based on counting sachets present at the time of a field visit. The expected number of sachets for 100% adherence is 14 sachets (7 days x 2 sachets per day). Values of LNS consumed that were negative or >28 were flagged.  Assessed for the household 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: LNS consumed flag
definition: Whether the number of lipid-based nutrient supplement (LNS) sachets consumed by the household per week was flagged for being negative or greater than 28. Assessed for the household 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Percent LNS consumed, caregiver report
definition: Percent of expected lipid-based nutrient supplement (LNS) sachets consumed by the household, as reported by the mother. The expected number of sachets for 100% adherence is 14 sachets (7 days x 2 sachets per day). Assessed for the household 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).
codebookDescription: Percent of expected LNS sachets consumed (reported)

label: LNS consumed, caregiver report
definition: Number of lipid-based nutrient supplement (LNS) sachets consumed by the household per week, as reported by the mother. The expected number of sachets for 100% adherence is 14 sachets (7 days x 2 sachets per day). Assessed for the household 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Maternal education level
definition: Categorization of the amount of education completed by the target child participant's mother. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Maternal education (years)
definition: Number of years of education completed by the target child participant's mother. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Paternal education (years)
definition: Number of years of education completed by the target child participant's father. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Persons living in house
definition: Total number of people that lived in the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Persons 18yrs and younger living in house
definition: Total number of children 18 years of age and younger that lived in the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Acres
definition: Acres of land owned by the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).
codebookDescription: Acres of land owned (q4110: How much homestead land (decimal) does your household own?)

label: Assets
definition: Whether the target child participant's household owns any of the following items. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Chair count
definition: Number of chairs owned by the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Chouki (traditional wooden bed) count
definition: Number of chouki (a traditional wooden bed that is an indicator of wealth in the study population) owned by the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Clock count
definition: Number of clocks owned by the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Cupboard count
definition: Number of wardrobes owned by the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Khat (traditional wooden table) count
definition: Number of khat (a traditional wooden table that is an indicator of wealth in the study population) owned by the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Mobile phone count
definition: Number of mobile phones owned by the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Table count
definition: Number of tables owned by the target child participant's household. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Severely stunted
definition: Whether the target child participant was severely stunted, defined as having a length- or height-for-age z-score of less than -3. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Stunted
definition: Whether the target child participant was stunted, defined as having a length- or height-for-age z-score of less than -2. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Severely wasted
definition: Whether the target child participant was severely wasted, defined as having a weight-for-length or -height z-score of less than -3. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Wasted
definition: Whether the target child participant was wasted, defined as having a weight-for-length or -height z-score of less than -2. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Severely underweight
definition: Whether the target child participant was severely underweight, defined as having a weight-for-age z-score of less than -3. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Underweight
definition: Whether the target child participant was underweight, defined as having a weight-for-age z-score of less than -2. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Length- or height-for-age z-score, using median stature
definition: Length- or height-for-age z-score for the target child participant, using median stature. Values greater than 6 or less than -6 were flagged and set to missing.  Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Length- or height-for-age z-score flag
definition: Whether the length- or height-for-age z-score for the target child participant was flagged for being greater than 6 or less than -6. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Weight-for-length or -height z-score, using median weight and median length or height
definition: Weight-for-length or -height z-score for the target child participant, using median weight and median length or height. Values greater than 5 or less than -5 were flagged and set to missing.  Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Weight-for-length or -height z-score flag
definition: Whether the weight-for-length or -height z-score for the target child participant was flagged for being greater than 5 or less than -5. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: BMI-for-age z-score, using median weight and median length or height
definition: BMI-for-age z-score for the target child participant, using median weight and median length or height. Values greater than 5 or less than -5 were flagged and set to missing.  Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: BMI-for-age z-score flag
definition: Whether the BMI-for-age z-score for the target child participant was flagged for being greater than 5 or less than -5. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Weight-for-age z-score, using median weight
definition: Weight-for-age z-score for the target child participant, using median weight. Values greater than 5 or less than -6 were flagged and set to missing.  Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Weight-for-age z-score flag
definition: Whether the weight-for-age z-score for the target child participant was flagged for being greater than 5 or less than -6. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).
codebookDescription: WAZ < -6 or WAZ > 5, set to missing

label: Head circumference-for-age z-score, using median circumference
definition: Head circumference-for-age z-score for the target child participant, using median circumference. Values greater than 5 or less than -5 were flagged and set to missing.  Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Head circumference-for-age z-score flag
definition: Whether the head circumference-for-age z-score for the target child participant was flagged for being greater than 5 or less than -5. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Median stature (cm)
definition: Median stature of the target child participant, in cm. Stature was measured as either recumbent length or height while standing.  Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Stature (cm)
definition: Measurement #1 of the stature of the target child participant, in cm. Stature was measured as either recumbent length or height while standing. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Stature (cm), 2nd
definition: Measurement #2 of the stature of the target child participant, in cm. Stature was measured as either recumbent length or height while standing. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Stature (cm), 3rd
definition: Measurement #3 of the stature of the target child participant, in cm. Stature was measured as either recumbent length or height while standing. A 3rd measurement was only taken if the difference between measures 1 & 2 was greater than or equal to 0.5 cm. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Median weight (kg)
definition: Median weight of the target child participant, in kg. Target child participant weight was either assessed directly or by measuring the weight of the mother plus the target child and subtracting out the mother's weight. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Weight (kg)
definition: Direct measurement #1 of the weight of the target child participant, in kg. These direct weight measurement were reserved for endline anthropometric assessment and did not occur at the midline assessment. Target child participants who were not weighed directly at the endline assessment were weighed in combination with their mother.

label: Weight (kg), 2nd
definition: Direct measurement #2 of the weight of the target child participant, in kg. These direct weight measurement were reserved for endline anthropometric assessment and did not occur at the midline assessment. Target child participants who were not weighed directly at the endline assessment were weighed in combination with their mother.

label: Weight (kg), 3rd
definition: Direct measurement #3 of the weight of the target child participant, in kg. These direct weight measurement were reserved for endline anthropometric assessment and did not occur at the midline assessment. Target child participants who were not weighed directly at the endline assessment were weighed in combination with their mother. A 3rd measurement was only taken if the difference between measures 1 & 2 is greater than or equal to 0.1 kg.

label: Median head circumference (cm)
definition: Median head circumference of the target child participant, in cm. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Head circumference (cm)
definition: Measurement #1 of the head circumference of the target child participant, in cm. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Head circumference (cm), 2nd
definition: Measurement #2 of the head circumference of the target child participant, in cm. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Head circumference (cm), 3rd
definition: Measurement #3 of the head circumference of the target child participant, in cm. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age).

label: Caregiver plus participant weight (kg)
definition: Measurement #1 of the weight of the target child participant plus the mother, in kg. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Mother plus target child participant weights may not have been recorded at the endline anthropometry assessment if the target child was weighed directly.

label: Caregiver plus participant weight (kg), 2nd
definition: Measurement #2 of the weight of the target child participant plus the mother, in kg. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Mother plus target child participant weights may not have been recorded at the endline anthropometry assessment if the target child was weighed directly.

label: Caregiver plus participant weight (kg), 3rd
definition: Measurement #3 of the weight of the target child participant plus the mother, in kg. A 3rd measurement was only taken if the difference between measures 1 & 2 is greater than or equal to 0.1 kg. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Mother plus target child participant weights may not have been recorded at the endline anthropometry assessment if the target child was weighed directly.

label: Caregiver weight (kg)
definition: Measurement #1 of the weight of the target child participant's mother, in kg. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Mother's weights may not have been recorded at the endline anthropometry assessment if the target child was weighed directly.

label: Caregiver weight (kg), 2nd
definition: Measurement #2 of the weight of the target child participant's mother, in kg. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Mother's weights may not have been recorded at the endline anthropometry assessment if the target child was weighed directly.

label: Caregiver weight (kg), 3rd
definition: Measurement #3 of the weight of the target child participant's mother, in kg. A 3rd measurement was only taken if the difference between measures 1 & 2 is greater than or equal to 0.1 kg. Anthropometry of target children was assessed 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Mother's weights may not have been recorded at the endline anthropometry assessment if the target child was weighed directly.

label: Age (days)
codebookDescription: Age in days (anthro meas) | Age in days

label: Study timepoint
definition: Survey data was collected at enrollment (baseline), and outcomes were measured after 12 months (midline) and 24 months (endline) of intervention delivery.

label: Assessment year
definition: Calendar year in which data on participants were collected.
codebookDescription: Year of survey | Year of anthropometry measurement

label: Assessment month
definition: Calendar month in which data on participants was collected.

label: Assessment week
definition: Calendar week in which data on participants were collected.
codebookDescription: Week of survey | Week of anthropometry measurement

label: Field research assistant code
definition: Code to identify the field research assistant who took the measurement. This was used as an adjustment variable in case there was any measurement bias based on who collected the data.

label: Diarrhea case during the last 7 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant was classified as a diarrhea case within the last 7 days. To meet the definition for a diarrhea case, the participant must have had 3+ loose or watery stools in 24 hours OR 1+ stool with blood. This variable, with a 7-day recall period, was used in the primary analysis to improve power as there was no evidence for differential recall by arm. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Diarrhea case during the last 2 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant was classified as a diarrhea case within the last 2 days. To meet the definition for a diarrhea case, the participant must have had 3+ loose or watery stools in 24 hours OR 1+ stool with blood. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Loose or watery stools during last 7 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had loose or watery stools within in the last 2 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Loose or watery stools during last 2 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had loose or watery stools within in the last 2 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Blood in stool during last 7 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had blood in their stools within in the last 7 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Blood in stool during last 2 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had blood in their stools within in the last 2 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: 3+ stools in 24hrs during last 7 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had 3 or more bowel movements in a 24 hour period within in the last 7 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: 3+ stools in 24hrs during last 2 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had 3 or more bowel movements in a 24 hour period within in the last 2 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Toothache during the last 7 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had a toothache (a negative control outcome measured to detect potential differential bias in symptom reporting) within in the last 7 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Toothache during the last 2 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had a toothache (a negative control outcome measured to detect potential differential bias in symptom reporting) within in the last 2 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Bruising during the last 7 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had bruising (a negative control outcome measured to detect potential differential bias in symptom reporting) within in the last 7 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Bruising during the last 2 days, caregiver report
definition: Whether the participant had bruising (a negative control outcome measured to detect potential differential bias in symptom reporting) within in the last 2 days. Caregiver reported symptoms were assessed in target children 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age). Caregiver reported symptoms were also assessed in sibling/neighbor participants at enrollment, midline, and endline.

label: Multiple birth
definition: Whether the target child participant was a twin.

label: Birth order
definition: Order the target child participant was born into their family.

label: Mother's age (years)
definition: Age of the target child participant's mother, in years. Assessed at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Median mother's height (cm)
definition: Median height of the target child participant's mother, in centimeters, based on measurements taken 1 year after intervention initiation (midline, when target children were 8-15m of age) and 2 years after intervention initiation (endline, when target children were 21-27m of age. Maternal height was measured in later visits and not at enrollment because it could have been influenced by pregnancy.

label: Father employed in agriculture
definition: Whether the target child participant's father worked in agriculture. Assessed for the household at enrollment (when target children were in utero).

label: Participant ID
definition: Unique identifier for the target child participant or sibling/neighbor participant.

label: Target child or sibling/neighbor
definition: Target child participants were in utero at enrollment and were the primary study population. Older sibling or neighbor participants were less than 36m at the time of target child enrollment.

label: Participant born after enrollment
definition: Compounds with a pregnant women were enrolled. Target child participants (the primary study population) were, by definition, in utero at enrollment and always born after enrollment. Older sibling or neighbor participants who were less than 36m at the time of enrollment or who were born during follow-up were also included as participants.
